data.title: good food
data.text: This is a very nice neighborhood restaurant, serving good food at reasonable prices.  There is usually a coupon in the local paper every week and their twist on the usual dinner roll is what they call croutons-except that these croutons ae not on your salad, they are served in a basket and are as bad for you as they are good tasting.  Consider yourself warned.  This is a nice place to visit-very busy on weekends, you may have a short wait to be seated.

data.title: NO Repeat on this one!
data.text: We love 'mom & pop' places, but this one was not worth the drive off the interstate.  My husband's steak was tough and my salmon was dry.  Facility is old and run down in appearance.  Bathrooms unacceptable.  Crouton basket (their version of a bread basket) was greasy.  Dinner roll served with meal:  flavorless.  Service was mediocre.

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Passing through and very pleased.  Steak done just right and friendly staff! Homemade rolls were a nice treat.  Wish we had room for desert.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Went to the Side Porch for dinner. Had a ribeye that was cooked a perfect medium rare. Staff was very nice and attentive.

data.title: a Bartlett Institution
data.text: We walked up at 5pm on a Saturday, and the place was packed.  We were told the wait would be an hour, but it was less than 20 minutes. Wonderful surprise.  The atmosphere is busy, bright, and the tables are close together.  If your first priority is an intimate, serene, quiet romantic dinner I wouldn't recommend.  However, the service was excellent and the steaks were the best. They were a bit underdone, which is par for the course at a good steakhouse. Order accordingly.  I loved the hometown old fashioned feel. The building is a converted home. Always a plus, in my book. It is in a very nice area of a lovely Memphis suburb.

data.title: Food
data.text: Food is always wonderful. The wait time is usually 30 minutes but they turn tables around very quickly. Great customer service. My favorite place in Memphis.

data.title: What A Find!
data.text: This is a definite keeper!  If you are in Memphis and want a great steak or seafood dinner without breaking the bank, ditch the familiar chains and go to Side Porch Steak House.  It is a favorite of locals, which says a lot right there.  The location is in an old clapboard house, and is not very big, but the wait is well worth it!  The servers are very efficient and get people in and out at a pretty steady speed, but they definitely don't rush you.   The marinade on the steaks is incredible, and the meat literally melts in your mouth.  Homemade salad dressings, rolls, and desserts make it a perfect dinner.  Hours are only 4:30-8:30, Tues-Sat., so plan accordingly.  You won't be sorry!

data.title: Great Place
data.text: I've been going to The Side Porch since it opened back in the mid 70's.  I even worked there in the early 90's.  Their marinade is legendary and they have many, many regulars.  It's a staple in the little town of Bartlett, TN!

data.title: Good portion for $18-22.00 steak
data.text: We had plenty left over for another meal. Glad we didn't order an appetizer as they also serve soup or salad and some garlic bread before the meal. One of the best steaks I've had. Quaint atmosphere. Small parking lot. Nice restaurant. Recommended A++++++++++

data.title: Family Friendly Prices with Excellent Quality Taste
data.text:
Every we vacation with my in laws and family we always have to find a good steak place to eat.  The entire time we were in Tennessee that all my father in law talked about.   We were all over Tennessee for a week that last few days were spent in Memphis. The night before we went to visit Graceland I went to look up a steak place that was in our family budget.  The Side Porch Steak Out house pop up on Trip advisor.  I had seen everyone reviews and look at the prices and said this might be the place for my family. 
We were a party of 7 adults and most of them are picky eaters.  On top of that they put A1 sauce on everything.  Everyone order some type of steak and everyone was pleasantly surprise. No use the A1 sauce on their steak what every seasoning they use made that steak delicious.   One of my aunt who normally eat half her meal at her entire meal.   We order mozzarella stick and onions petals as appetizer and they were really good.    Their price were very family friendly.  This place is gear towards locals.  
We took our dessert to go and had later in the evening it was so good.   If you are a family that vacation on a budget but want good quality food go to the Side Porch Steak House.

data.title: Chicken at a steak house
data.text: Family of eight with five adults, one teen, and two small children enjoyed Mother's day in Bartlett, Tennessee for dinner.  Even though it is a steak house, we all had chicken and pork chops.  We have been here before and had their wonderful steaks.  We went for a change and found the variety as great as their steaks.

data.title: Local steakhouse
data.text: I've been wanting to go back to this steakhouse but life have been busy. Anyway, I just remembered this steakhouse again and now craving for some steak. The ambiance has a feel like you're just at home eating some perfectly cooked steak! The people who works there were very nice to us too. When it's time to pay, I was surprise to pay less than what we would normally pay for what we ate at other steakhouse. Definitely recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Best steak house around!
data.text: I have ate here since I was a child and it has always been great. Never have we been let down by the food or the service. Great little family friendly steak house!

data.title: Very Good
data.text: The steakhouse has been there forever.  Nice family feel. They brought out a basket of bread even before we ordered. It was so buttery and good. I ordered the ribeye steak medium rare and the loaded bake potato.  Both were very good. The prices are real reasonable and the service was good. I put it on my list of places to visit again. :)

data.title: Great
data.text: Service and food was great.  The place was packed but our wait wasn't long. They have awesome huge crouton bread type snacks before the dishes are served. I ordered steak and it was cooked perfectly.  Will definitely return.

data.title: Who'd have thought!
data.text: Looking for a quiet yummy place in Memphis where you can go as you are!  What a wonderful place right on Stage Road.  Unassuming that inside the food and family friendly dining experience could be found.  Found the location via a google search.  Wanting a hometown restaurant in such a large location with so much to offer.  We pulled up, parked with another dozen or so vehicles... walked in through the "side porch".  Greeted immediately into the main level dining area.  Eclectic furnishing, nothing pretencious.  There were four other table already seated.  Our server took our drink order, brought delicious toasted garlic bread, took our orders.  GREAT steaks and Fried Shrimp appetizer.  Super pricing, filling our bellies.  We will certainly be back our next time stopping in Memphis.

data.title: Not very good
data.text: I didn't expect much seeing as how my salad dressing is served in a plastic cup  but I did at least expect a decent steak. I ordered a fillet medium rare and what I got was raw. The server then grabbed my plate and said she would heat it up. Having cut the steak in several places to check the cook I told her if she puts that in an oven it will dry out, I would prefer a fresh steak. After i requested a new steak I was then insulted by the manager pointing out what exactly medium rare is. Honestly, with your food cost and your cheap cuts of meat you are out what.....a few bucks? Do not insult my intelligence. I have had steak at real steakhouses like Ruth's, Flemings and Folks Folly. I know steak! Apparently anyone who thinks this place has good steak had never had a REALLY good steak. So as I anticipated my second steak was overcooked. When the manager came by to check I just politely nodded that all was good. Packed up the steak to go and fed it to my dog. Won't go back. Rather spend the extra money for quality and ambience.

data.title: Over all, very good.
data.text: Very crowded on a Saturday night. We went at 7 for a Birthday and when we were leaving at about 8:30, they were still seating people. Wait staff was friendly and efficient. I love that the drinks come in a large mason jar! Salad was a bit small, but the tomato basil salad dressing was very tasty. I had the tilapia with a baked sweet potato. Tilapia was cooked until perfectly tender, good and buttery, but just a tad salty. Baked sweet potato was good and came with a side of cinnamon sugar. A glass of wine was a bit small, or rather in too big of a glass, makes for an optical illusion. Over all, yes I would like to eat here again.

data.title: Seafood lover
data.text: I must admit,  Side Porch Steakhouse was more than I expected. I had the grilled salmon and my friend had the steak. From the beginning to the end, it was memorable. Atmosphere was intimate and the server was personable. Great salmon!!!!

data.title: The Steak was good, everything else blah
data.text: I have been to Side Porch before. It is a simple place, nothing fancy at all, but there food has always been pretty good. Their homemade croutons were a good start. I had the zucchini appetizer which was awful. The salad came from a bag, covered in cheese  and the dressing was not good. The steak was well cooked just right, seasoned well, and tender. The baked potato was very typical. I can get a good steak other places. I would not come back unless it was a friends birthday , and that was where they wanted to go.
